### ðŸ’» Explanation of each command line:
```matlab
function volume
% Computes the volume of the solid of revolution generated by two functions f1 and f2 around the x-axis

syms x  % Declare symbolic variable x

% Input two functions f1(x) and f2(x) from the user
f1 = input('Enter function f1(x) = ');
f2 = input('Enter function f2(x) = ');

% Plot the two functions for visualization
ezplot(f1);        % Plot the first function f1
hold on            % Hold the current plot to overlay the next plot
ezplot(f2);        % Plot the second function f2
hold off           % Release the plot hold

% Solve the equation f1 = f2 to find intersection points in x
m = solve(f1 - f2, x);
m = union(m, m);         % Remove any duplicate solutions
m = double(m);           % Convert symbolic solutions to numeric values

% Filter out complex solutions, keep only real x-values
i = 1;
while i <= length(m)
    if abs(imag(m(i))) > 0.0001     % If imaginary part is significant, remove the value
        m(i) = [];
        i = i - 1;                  % Adjust index due to deletion
    else
        m(i) = m(i) - imag(m(i)) * 1i;  % Keep only the real part
    end
    i = i + 1;
end

% Display intersection points if found
if ~isempty(m)
    disp('Intersection points of the two graphs are:')
    for j = 1:length(m)
        disp(['(' num2str(m(j)) ', ' num2str(subs(f1, x, m(j))) ')'])
    end
end

% Check the number of intersection points
if length(m) > 2
    disp('f1 and f2 have more than 2 intersection points')
elseif length(m) < 2
    disp('f1 and f2 have less than 2 intersection points')
else
    % If there are exactly two intersection points, continue calculation
    warning off  % Suppress symbolic warnings (e.g., imaginary solutions)

    % Find x-intercepts (roots) of both functions
    n = union([solve(f1); solve(f2)], [solve(f1); solve(f2)]);

    % Remove non-real (complex) solutions
    i = 1;
    while i <= length(n)
        if ~isreal(n(i))
            n(i) = [];
            i = i - 1;
        end
        i = i + 1;
    end

    n = double(n);  % Convert symbolic roots to numeric values

    % Check if there is any x-intercept between the intersection points
    for i = 1:length(n)
        if n(i) < max(m) && n(i) > min(m)
            disp('There is an x-intercept within the region between the curves')
            return  % If yes, abort volume calculation due to undefined region
        end
    end

    % Calculate the volume of revolution using disk method
    V = pi * abs( int(f1^2, x, min(m), max(m)) - int(f2^2, x, min(m), max(m)) );
    V = double(V);  % Convert symbolic result to numeric

    % Display the final volume
    text = ['Volume of revolution V = ' num2str(V)];
    disp(text)
end

end
